intro: Anthospermum monticola, commonly known as the mountain anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Anthospermum monticola is adapted to thrive in cooler, high-altitude environments, making it a unique component of alpine flora.
